answerText: lysogenic cycle[10] One phage which can switch between the lysogenic and lytic cycles is this one, which has a double-stranded DNA genome, and whose genome contains proteins such as cro and cIII, which help determine which cycle it enters.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 8 | 10 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This cycle tends to occur when there's a high multiplicity of infection, or when infected cells are lacking in resources. [10] Name this cycle that sees a virus embed itself within its host's genome, which is contrasted with the lytic cycle.
